title: Cappuccino Pound Cake with Bittersweet Chocolate

instructions.1: Preheat an oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C). Grease and flour a 10-inch tube pan. Whisk the flour and baking soda together until blended.
instructions.2: In a large bowl, mash the butter, cream cheese, white sugar and brown sugar with a spoon until the mixture is creamy and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 egg at a time, mixing it in completely before adding the next one. Stir the vanilla extract with the instant espresso powder in a small bowl, and add it to the butter mixture. Stir in until well combined.
instructions.3: Stir the flour mixture into the butter mixture in 1/2-cup quantities until the flour has been thoroughly incorporated. Stir in the chopped dark chocolate. Spoon the batter into the prepared cake pan.
instructions.4: Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean, about 1 1/2 hours. Start checking for doneness after about 1 hour and 15 minutes. Cool the cake in the pan for about 10 minutes, then turn out onto a cake dish and allow to finish cooling. Dust with confectioners' sugar.

questions.question: In Step 4, is the oven from Step 1 being used?
Is oven from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is flour from Step 1 used in multiple future steps without being redefined?
Is oven from Step 1 still available in Step 2?
What is the last time interval specified in Step 4?
If we skip Step 1, is it still valid to incorporate the flour in Step 3?
Can we preheat (Step 1) and bake (Step 4) at the same time?
